reasoning: Cardiac arrhythmias encompass multiple heart rhythm disorders. Incidence of clinically significant arrhythmias ~500 per 100k person-years globally; prevalence varies with age from <1% in young adults to >10% in elderly. Data from international arrhythmia registries and epidemiological surveys.
source: Camm AJ et al. (2012). 2012 focused update of the ESC Guidelines for atrial fibrillation. Eur Heart J. 33(21):2719-2747
